title: Akana, Russia
content:
Akana (Russian: Акана; Yakut: Акана) is a rural locality (a selo), the administrative centre of and one of two settlements, in addition to Chkalov, in Akaninsky Rural Okrug of Nyurbinsky District in the Sakha Republic, Russia. It is located 70 kilometers (43 mi) from Nyurba, the administrative center of the district. Its population as of the 2010 Census was 461;[2] down from 495 recorded during the 2002 Census.[1]
